page.title: 01THE KNOTTINGLEY AREA
page.content: Knottingley is a town with a population of 19,000 people. It is situated on the south side of the River Aire, which runs from Knottingley to Goole, about 17 miles.To the north of the Aire is Brotherton Marsh, Byram and Brotherton village. Knottingley is on the edge of an industrial area. The main industries are, glass, chemical, ship repairs, engineering and nearby the power station. There is some farming, and a small pottery. There are a number of housing estates mainly council houses with some private houses. The A1, to the west side of Knottingley runs from London to Scotland. There are quite a few old quarries. The railway also runs to the south and west. There are 4 main shopping areas. The sports centre provides leisure and recreation.
